description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6naq9","text":"Gastruloids are a powerful in vitro model of early human development. However, although elongated and composed of all three germ layers, human gastruloids do not morphologically resemble post-implantation human embryos. Here we show an early pulse of retinoic acid (RA), together with Matrigel, robustly induces human gastruloids with posterior embryo-like morphological structures, including a neural tube flanked by segmented somites, and diverse cell types including neural crest, neural progenitors, renal progenitors, and myocytes. Through in silico staging based on single-cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq), we find human RA-gastruloids to be more advanced than other embryo models, and comparable to E9.5 mouse and CS11 cynomolgus monkey embryos. We leverage chemical and genetic perturbations of RA-gastruloids to confirm that WNT and BMP signalling regulate somite formation and neural tube length in the human context, while transcription factors TBX6 and PAX3 underpin presomitic mesoderm and neural crest, respectively. Looking forward, RA-gastruloids are a robust, scalable model for decoding early human embryogenesis.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qrm0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Any action you take or refrain from taking using or relying upon the information presented here is strictly at your own risk. You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":631,"length":12}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"f4d51","text":"Our research on the induction and molecular analysis of human conventional and RA-gastruloids was reviewed and approved by the Embryonic Stem Cell Research Oversight (ESCRO) of the University of Washington (E0047-001), and is in compliance with the principles laid out by the ISSCR Guidelines for Stem Cell Research and Clinical Applications of Stem Cells21. No new experiments involving human embryos were performed in this study, and all natural human embryo data analysed were obtained from publicly available datasets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":355,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"98334FFA2CDA11EF83D90A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://paperpile.com/c/VbXx89/97LOB"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Day0, Passage human PSCs onto vitronectin-coated NutriStem
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bhu29","text":"Coat wells with Vitronectin and incubate them in 37C for at least 15 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day0, Passage human PSCs onto vitronectin-coated NutriStem
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8vtcp","text":"Dissociate pre-treated ESCs","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day0, Passage human PSCs onto vitronectin-coated NutriStem
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8jr9h","text":"Aspirate media from wells and wash wells with PBS(-) and aspirate PBS (-)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day0, Passage human PSCs onto vitronectin-coated NutriStem
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3t61j","text":"Add 500 µL Accutase to each well and incubate them at 37C for 4 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day0, Passage human PSCs onto vitronectin-coated NutriStem
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6drml","text":"Quench the reaction by adding 2 mL of Wash media containing 10 µM Y-27632 media and pipette up and down ~10 times in a well to dissociate cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day0, Passage human PSCs onto vitronectin-coated NutriStem
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8s1ci","text":"Transfer them to a new 15mL tube and centrifuge for 3 min at 300 g","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day0, Passage human PSCs onto vitronectin-coated NutriStem
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"59ok1","text":"Suspend them in NutriStem containing 10 µM Y-27632 and spread 2 × 104 cells for 1/12 well onto each vitronectin-coated well","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":68,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7227","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1n707","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2dn9q","text":"The number of seeding cells on the pre-treatment plate is important for later gastruloid elongation and needs to be optimized for each lab and each cell line.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4stsd","text":"On day 1, Change medium to fresh NutriStem medium containing 5 µM Y-27632","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6u9f7","text":"On day 2, Change the medium to fresh NutriStem medium containing 4 µM CHIR","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2o6m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e7ovv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"23obv","text":"CHIR concentrations and duration of treatment should be optimized for each CHIR batch and/or each cell line. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"36urr","text":"CHIR should be used within three months from the aliquoting.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6624r","text":"On day 3, Change medium to fresh NutriStem medium containing 4 µM CHIR + 500 nM RA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51v9g","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ov1u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"31veh","text":"The concentrations of CHIR and RA should be optimized for each cell line.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1h9ea","text":"On day 4, prepare the following reagents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5358u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evg6a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8gbbd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3p245","text":"Accutase = 500µL for 1/12 well","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b19n7","text":"Wash media + 10 µM Y-27632 = 2 mL for 1/12 well","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"crl3b","text":"Essential 6 medium + 1 µM CHIR + 5 µM Y-27632 = 50µL / well + 10%","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6prdi","text":"Aspirate media from wells and wash wells with PBS(-) and aspirate PBS (-)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d01gi","text":"Add 500µL Accutase to each well and incubate them in 37C for 4 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8v2id","text":"Quench the reaction by adding 2 mL of Wash+Y media to each well and pipette up and down ~10 times in a well to dissociate cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"q9t8","text":"Transfer them to a new 15 mL tube and centrifuge for 3 min at 300 g","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"19jvc","text":"Wash again with 2 mL Essential6 + 1µM CHIR + Y and centrifuge it again","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"57qr7","text":"Resuspend them in 1-2 mL Essential 6 + Y medium and count cells by Countess","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5uop5","text":"Transfer the necessary number of cells (4000 cells/well) into a reservoir containing a medium (50 µl/well)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1qagt","text":"Spread cells with a multi-channel pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b3bho","text":"Incubate them in 37C incubator","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"57m07","text":"On day 5 (+24h from RA-gastruloid induction), add 150 µL Essential 6 media to each well.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7thc3","text":"On day 6 (+48h from RA-gastruloid induction), carefully remove 150 µL medium and add 150 µL of fresh Essential 6 medium, containing 100 nM RA and 5% Matrigel","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eoi46","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"l6ok","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dpoak","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4ldfh","text":"At this moment, you would see some elongation of RA-gastruloids","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4tdk9","text":"On day 9 (+120h from RA-gastruloid induction), you should see the fully elongated RA-gastruloid with neural tube and segmented somites","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Human RA-gastruloid induction from pluripotent stem cells
